AP Celebration: This year, we offered AP Literature for the first time, and our students CONQUERED the AP exam, with 73% of students scoring a 3 or above.

For comparison, last year in Missouri, 21% of students who took and passed the AP Lit exam identified as a student of color - that means in our first year of taking the AP Lit exam, we averaged TRIPLE the pass rate for students of color. We know these results continue to prove what is possible for black and brown students tackling academically-challenging courses like AP. #provewhatspossible #changethenarrative

Coming at ya this Wednesday evening with some big news to share.

At the Kauffman School, ALL high school students have opportunity to take AP courses. We know these courses push our students' thinking and expose students to the intellectual challenge that mirrors college classes. And, we push for AP access because we know that nationally, black and brown students typically have less opportunity to take these challenging courses (read more about the AP access gap from a student's perspective here: https://bit.ly/2Xv117G). We fundamentally believe that equity in education means students of color SHOULD have opportunities like these.

This spring, students took the AP Calc test and showed incredible results: 50% of students scored a 3 or above on the test. Congrats to our students, families, and math educators from 5th through 12th grade for this collective WIN. #APforALL
